body_html:
Ah, I see. In that case, I think your best options might be:

  • Handle the transformations when parsing the data, produce the multi-hot column, and pass in to a sequence numeric column. Since the data is already multi-hot, sequence numerical is appropriate.
  • Pass the data through as an indicator column, and handle to summation/collapsing in your model code before passing through to the RNN/other layers.
  • Create a mutli-hot indicator column that meets the needs here, and contribute it back to TensorFlow for others to use.

Thoughts?

Handle the transformations when parsing the data, produce the multi-hot column, and pass in to a sequence numeric column. Since the data is already multi-hot, sequence numerical is appropriate.
Pass the data through as an indicator column, and handle to summation/collapsing in your model code before passing through to the RNN/other layers.
Create a mutli-hot indicator column that meets the needs here, and contribute it back to TensorFlow for others to use.

Thoughts?
body:
Ah, I see. In that case, I think your best options might be:
* Handle the transformations when parsing the data, produce the multi-hot column, and pass in to a sequence numeric column. Since the data is already multi-hot, sequence numerical is appropriate.
* Pass the data through as an indicator column, and handle to summation/collapsing in your model code before passing through to the RNN/other layers.
* Create a mutli-hot indicator column that meets the needs here, and contribute it back to TensorFlow for others to use.

Thoughts?
